1437 Kansas mayor charged with allegedly voting as non-citizen in elections (justthenews.com) posted 6 days ago by Sea_Still 73 comments award share report block Kansas mayor charged with allegedly voting as non-citizen in elections Coldwater Mayor Joe Ceballos, who is a lawful permanent resident from Mexico, allegedly voted in elections in 2022, 2023, and 2024 justthenews.com
73 comments Sort by Top Top New Worst Old Save Elon Just Walked Away – And His Reason Changes Everything Read More Ads by Ad.Style TooTrue-translation 59 points 6 days ago This raises the question, what did the Biden regime do in terms of "federal oversight" of elections that meant anything? We need election integrity overhaul big time, and Trump is really good at enforcing laws/policies already in place. permalink award report block reply Chickensaurus 42 points 6 days ago They made sure illegals could vote. permalink parent award report block reply IForgotToAddAnEmail 15 points 6 days ago Was the whole 'Mail in Ballot' scam taking care of or are they all still doing that? Could means they changed laws to allow illegals to vote. He said he felt Kansas elections are secure, but this shit happens under his watch. permalink award report block reply NY2KCMO1776 7 points 6 days ago When I had to switch to a kansas drivers license in 2024, I went to THE DMV in Johnson County.   I was one of the few people that spoke English in the office.  After I got my license I looked at the paperwork.  There it was written in big bold letters that you don't have to be a citizen or prove citizenship to vote in elections.  Yes that's right.  I went to the ks attorney general website and it said the same thing.  You could sign an affidavit allowing you to vote without providing any documents to verify who you are. I reached Out to Kris Kobach personally and Info wars.  I got the info out about this.  I was trying to sound the alarm before the election. Now the info about the affidavit is gone off their website.  Hopefully this stopped illegals from voting permalink parent award report block reply N14205ST205 1 points 6 days ago Fellow JoCo resident here. Respect! Thanks for standing up for what's right and getting the word out there. permalink parent award report block reply OldGreg 13 points 6 days ago My question is:  how?  We have voting ID to the point that you have to scan your state ID for ballot eligibility. Now the info about the affidavit is gone off their website.
